column4: when do do "sudo apt-get upgrade" it says that some mozilla-firefox things have been held back, why? do I want to get it anyways? and how?

sorry, pastebin?
hmm.....like spanish said, apt-get holds back packages tht cause a conflict, but conflict with wht :S
maybe ur running firefox and tht could be the reason?
ah maybe!
nope
I was using the synaptic thingy before and it looks like it's the 1.04 version of firefox, which I need/want...
the firefox installed with ubuntu is alreadt 1.0.4, just tht they forgot to increment the version number
could the upgrade fix that version number?
heres wht u do...go to firefox and type about:config in the address bar
now find the key general.useraget.vendorsub.and edit its value to read 1.0.4
thanks! any other changes to about:config I should do (other than those listed in the ubuntuguide)?
nope....tht will get u started with the extentions for firefox, if thts wht u wanted to do

palm, can't get it to recognize computer, or viceversa
